text: Emperor is the debut EP by the black metal band of the same name. It was released in 1993 by Candlelight. In 1993, the EP was made into a split album with Enslaved’s EP Hordanes Land. In 1998, it was reissued with their demo Wrath Of The Tyrant. Songs “Wrath Of The Tyrant” and “Night Of The Graveless Souls” were rerecorded, and were originally on the Wrath Of The Tyrant demo. ==Cover== The cover of the EP is an engraving by Gustave Doré called “Death on a Pale Horse". ==Track listing== ==Personnel== *Emperor **Ihsahn – vocals, guitar; synthesizer **Samoth – guitar **Mortiis – bass guitar **Faust – drums *Additional personnel **Emperor – producer **Christophe Szpajdel – logo ==References== Category:Emperor (band) albums Category:1993 EPs
title: Emperor (EP)
